title: Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area: History & Culture
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture             History & Culture       The mighty Columbia River has drawn people to its waters for over 9,000 years. Plateau peoples thrived on its rich fisheries. Trappers and traders plied its currents and rapids. The last frontier post stood watch on its shores. Grand Coulee Dam transformed the river into Lake Roosevelt. Its salmon lost, the new reservoir helped power the Northwest. Today, its scenery and stories wait for you.  Â     Soldier, Settlers and Indians NPS
